Resolved Question Show me another » What do you suggest I observe? Honestly this is supposed to be in the Anthropology section (ethnography) because this is for an anthropology subject, unfortunately I don't get a lot of responses in it, and I also thought maybe Psychology people could help because they're both nuder Social sciences.
So I'm supposed to observe people in a particular location in which I always go to (routine), and to discover things I didn't know before. I thought of doing it in the fast food chain I always eat in during lunch, but I don't know what to observe because they'll all be just eating. So can you suggest? Like, what to observe, or maybe a new topic? 2 years ago Report Abuse
Additional Details If you want, more details here: http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index;_ylt=Auu2qgGol2h2VxwpNCjWRY_sy6IX;_ylv=3?qid=20100629051440AA5dqpr 2 years ago by Joshua Member since: June 09, 2010 Total points: 226 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker You were wise in choosing the psychology secion because your task is asking you to extend common knowledge. You said your assignment is to go to a place where you typically go and observe things about people you never noticed before,correct? Well for starters your going into it with the wrong mindset. You are thinking about what the people should typically do at that location. For example if people come to a fast food restaurant they must be eating.
Your assignment isnt asking you to theorize but observe.The same way you visit a food venue on a occasional basis im pretty sure someone else does to. Look beyond the fact their they are eating but look at other things. What they wear, the way they dress, how they eat, how fast they eat. Create a daily log of actions that you observe them doing and your complete assignment should look something like this.
"Mr. Jones lhas a thing for Mrs.kathy, but how would I know this. You see every day Mr.Jones come down to the Cafe'Diner at exactly 11pm the same time that Mrs.Kathy arrives everyday. Mr.Jones is always neatly pressed, freshly trimmed and always scented with this strange cologne. He always gets a seat at the bar which so happens to be Ms.Kathy's station.He only orders things that she has to personally prepare and he always leaves a minimum of 10 dollars for a tip. Mr. Jones eats his food extremely fast he always leaves exactly at 12pm except for on Wendsdays, but he also has on regular clothes so I assume Wensdays are his only off days."
Thhats just how your final character evaluation should look.There is so much you can learn doing observations, just open your mind up and watch. 2 years ago Report Abuse Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: thank you Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting!
